comments.creator: hibbard.simon@gmail.com
comments.author: hibbard.simon@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 558758
ff-problem.jpg

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

Fixed Div at top of page with background color. Second div fixed below it with text inside. 

See: http://lsp2.tpdserver2.co.uk/test.htm

Image: http://lsp2.tpdserver2.co.uk/ff-problem.jpg


Actual results:

If background color is not set on second div the first one shows a thin white line around it.


Expected results:

First div should not be effected by the second.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

Fixed Div at top of page with background color. Second div fixed below it with text inside. 

See: http://lsp2.tpdserver2.co.uk/test.htm

Image: http://lsp2.tpdserver2.co.uk/ff-problem.jpg


Actual results:

If background color is not set on second div the first one shows a thin white line around it.


Expected results:

First div should not be effected by the second.

comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text: I can't reproduce this, but it sounds similar to a bug roc fixed recently....
comments.raw_text: I can't reproduce this, but it sounds similar to a bug roc fixed recently....
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
Note: Have only tried on Win7 machines.

Also if the second element has a lower z-index than the first, the problem does not occur.
